data.title: Pulse Music Board
data.meta_description: One of my favorite Madonna songs of all time. This one is just brilliant. I thought the hook of the song is very catchy and the layer of accoustic guitar in the song adds a touch of poignancy.
data.text:
Post by Brethren on

One of my favorite Madonna songs of all time. This one is just brilliant. I thought the hook of the song is very catchy and the layer of accoustic guitar in the song adds a touch of poignancy.

Post by prenatt1166 on

UU-BRU Internet Radio

For Week Ending November 5, 1994[/color]

(Rank This Week, Last Week, Artist, Title)

01 01 Boyz II Men - I'll Make Love To You

02 03 Madonna - Secret

03 08 Eagles - Get Over It

04 05 Gloria Estefan - Turn The Beat Around

05 06 Bon Jovi - Always

06 02 Sheryl Crow - All I Wanna Do

07 07 Elton John - Circle Of Life

08 04 Luther Vandross & Mariah Carey - Endless Love

09 11 Pretenders - I'll Stand By You

10 10 4PM - Sukiyaki

"Secret" spent 3 weeks at #2, landing at #17 for 1994.

www.keystonehighways.com/uubru1994.html

"Secret" is one of 13 songs by Madonna to peak at #2 on my chart. No other act has peaked at #2 with more than 4 times.

www.keystonehighways.com/uubruhistory.com

:)

Post by blfdguy1 on

"Secret" was Madonna's 14th of 21 #1's on my chart. Love the song, love the video and the remix is hot, too!

November 5, 1994

01 02 Secret - Madonna

02 01 100% Pure Love - Crystal Waters

03 03 I'm The Only One - Melissa Etheridge

04 06 I'll Stand By You - Pretenders

05 07 Turn The Beat Around - Gloria Estefan

06 04 Basket Case - Green Day

07 08 You Gotta Be - Desree

08 11 I Alone - Live

09 12 Interstate Love Song - STP

10 14 Another Night - Real McCoy

"Secret" spent 6 weeks at #1, but I can't find my yearend chart for 1994 :( but did sneak in at #97 for 1995

Post by halo19 on

Not my fav. Madonna single, but this would probably be in a top 10 list if I had one. One of the few songs that I can say that I recall from when they were released that is from around 10 years or longer ago.

Post by crash46 on

This is probably the first Madonna song that I really enjoyed (I also like "This Used To Be My Playground", but I actually heard "Secret" first). Just about all her songs from here on out have been nothing short of excellent. Just about.

Didn't this song move like 30-8 in its second week? I got sick of her songs doing that so often. The radio would slam her songs at me non stop and I'd be burned out on them before I could give myself a fair chance to like them.

Post by ðŸ…³ðŸ…¸ðŸ†‚ðŸ…²ðŸ…¾ on

This song was really well-done. Madonna's voice was amazing. That guitar in the song is a real focal point. And the mid-tempo beat.

And that black and white video was a lot of fun.

Junior Vasquez's remixes were excellent.

Post by bubblepop15 on

I hate when people start talking about singers moving on to new project so early.

I haven't even heard COADF, but I love Madonna's R&B sound.

I don't think she would ever do another R&B record...

This song is on fiyah

Post by Ky on

zak said:

One of Madonna's best tracks, its so smooth. I'm suprised it was a first single though as its very kind of low-key

I really couldn't appreciate a low-key song as much back then. I didn't dislike it. Now I really like it.

Post by Deleted on

Awesome song, and it shot from 30-9-4 and peaked at 3 in the US.

crash46 said:

This is probably the first Madonna song that I really enjoyed (I also like "This Used To Be My Playground", but I actually heard "Secret" first). Just about all her songs from here on out have been nothing short of excellent. Just about.

Didn't this song move like 30-8 in its second week? I got sick of her songs doing that so often. The radio would slam her songs at me non stop and I'd be burned out on them before I could give myself a fair chance to like them.

Post by sunpeach on

Great song- and the dance version of it was even better- I remember when it would come on in the club- just fantastic- and the video of it was good, too- of her playing the guitar- it was catchy. "Frozen" was sort of a part 2 of this because they sound alike.

Post by Brethren on

It's been 14 years. I used to like her a lot, but I can barely stand her now.

And more than 4 years since I posted this topic. Time really flies.

Post by esoteric76 on

This and Frozen are like sister tracks, with Frozen being the slightly darker, gothic-lite sister. (or whatever I'm trying to say).

I remember being obsessed with Secret when it came out, and listening to it and the remixes endlessly. It has aged really well.
